alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued December 26 at 7:46AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH IMMEDIATE BROADCAST REQUESTED 07:05 PST Mon Dec 26 2022 The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH for the following areas: NWS Las Vegas NV - CA-519 (Eastern Sierra in Inyo County) NWS Reno NV - CA-073 (Eastern Sierra in Mono County) * WHAT...The avalanche danger is expected to rise to HIGH late tonight. Dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to continue into tomorrow. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virginia Lakes to the north to Bishop Creek to the south. * WHEN...In effect from Mon 07:05 PST to Tue 10:00 PST. * IMPACTS...A large atmospheric river will bring periods of heavy rain on snow into the mid elevations stressing an already weak snowpack. Strong winds and heavy snowfall at higher elevations will also create Dangerous avalanche conditions. * PRECAUTIONARY / PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to develop within the next 24 hours. Avalanches may run long distances, into mature forests, valley floors, or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org/ or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
